title: Contributing
text: Awesome reading . questions, can create Issue Code changes go via Pull Requests Please note package released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Contributing
text: Submitted code follow quality guidelines: tests pass cleanly/silently Code coverage must 100% Coding style follow default style lintr checked Travis CI submitting Pull Request. Emails code accepted.

title: Contributing
text: Awesome. options: Add Issue, reprex Submit Pull Request, test added tests/testthat folder. Fork develop branch Send @richelbilderbeek email (@richelbilderbeek make Issue ) Pull Requests follow guidelines ‘Submitting code’.

title: Contributing
text: master branch always build successfully development branch developers

title: Demo
text: Given DNA alignment, one wonders phylogenetic inference model fits alignment best. mcbette (‘Model Comparison using babette’) can give answer. example, use ‘BEAST2’ example alignment compare fit two inference models alignment. ’ll interpret finding end, concluding inference model use.

title: Demo
text: First, load mcbette: use mcbette, BEAST2 BEAST2 NS package must installed: ’ve just gotten message need install either BEAST2 BEAST2 NS package, . rest vignette empty.
code: library(mcbette) if (rappdirs::app_dir()$os == "win") {   message("'mcbette' can only run on Linux and MacOS") } else if (!beastier::is_beast2_installed()) {   message(     "BEAST2 must be installed. ",     "Tip: use 'beastier::install_beast2()'"   ) } else if (!mauricer::is_beast2_ns_pkg_installed()) {   message(     "The BEAST2 'NS' package must be installed. ",     "Tip: use 'mauricer::install_beast2_pkg(\"NS\")'"   ) } #> BEAST2 must be installed. Tip: use 'beastier::install_beast2()'

title: Demo
text: run mcbette, need FASTA file DNA alignment . use one present mcbette package: Now alignment saved FASTA file, can display :  mcbette allows one select evolutionary model heighest evidence (aka marginal likelihood) generated alignment. information set inference model, see ‘Inference models’ vignette beautier package: example, compare two evolutionary models alignment shown . best evolutionary model likely used Bayesian inference, example use ‘evolutionary model’ ‘inference model’ interchangably. One inference models default babette inference model. differing nucleotide substitution model: JC69: nucleotides share mutation rate. example, mutation rate adenine cytosine mutation rate guanine thymine GTR: different mutation rate nucleotide nucleotide results interpreted interpret_marg_lik_estimates follows: Clean :
code: fasta_filename <- system.file("extdata", "primates.fas", package = "mcbette") alignment <- ape::read.FASTA(fasta_filename) image(alignment) vignette("beautier", "inference_models") inference_model_1 <- beautier::create_ns_inference_model() inference_model_1$site_model$name #> [1] "JC69" if (can_run_mcbette()) {   # Create the two inference models   inference_model_1 <- beautier::create_ns_inference_model(     site_model = beautier::create_jc69_site_model()   )   inference_model_2 <- beautier::create_ns_inference_model(     site_model = beautier::create_gtr_site_model()   )   # Shorten the run, by doing a short (dirty, unreliable) MCMC   inference_model_1$mcmc <- beautier::create_test_ns_mcmc()   inference_model_2$mcmc <- beautier::create_test_ns_mcmc()    # Combine the two inference models   inference_models <- c(list(inference_model_1), list(inference_model_2))    # Compare the the two inference models   marg_liks <- est_marg_liks(     fasta_filename = fasta_filename,     inference_models = inference_models   )   knitr::kable(marg_liks) } if (can_run_mcbette()) {   interpret_marg_lik_estimates(marg_liks) } beastier::remove_beaustier_folders()

title: Authors and Citation
text: Bilderbeek RJ (2020). “mcbette: model comparison using babette.” Journal Open Source Software. https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.02762.
code: @Article{,   author = {Richèl JC Bilderbeek},   title = {mcbette: model comparison using babette},   journal = {Journal of Open Source Software},   year = {2020},   url = {https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.02762}, }

title: Model Comparison Using babette
text: mcbette allows Model Comparison using babette (hence name), , given (say, DNA) alignment, compares multiple phylogenetic inference models find model likeliest generate alignment. , one can find phylogenetic inference model simple enough, simple. , mcbette uses babette [Bilderbeek Etienne, 2018] addition using BEAST2 [Bouckaert et al., 2019] nested sampling package described [Russell et al., 2019].

title: Model Comparison Using babette
text: ⚠️ mcbette works Linux Mac. mcbette depends rJava Rmpfr packages. Linux, install , (root): , installing mcbette rather easy: Note mcbette uses non-CRAN extensions beastierinstall mauricerinstall install uninstall BEAST2 packages.
code: apt install r-cran-rjava libmpfr-dev install.packages("mcbette") remotes::install_github("richelbilderbeek/beastierinstall") beastierinstall::install_beast2() remotes::install_github("richelbilderbeek/mauricerinstall") mauricerinstall::install_beast2_pkg("NS")

title: Model Comparison Using babette
text: Suppose DNA alignment, obtained sequencing multiple species:  Note alignment holds little information really base publishable research . create posterior distribution phylogenies alignment, one needs specify inference model. inference model (among others) combination site model, clock model tree model. See ‘Available models’ section see available models. example let two inference models compete. default inference model: JC69 site model assumes four DNA nucleotides equally likely mutate /. strict clock model assumes mutation rates species equal. Yule tree model assumes new species form constant rate extinction rate zero. competing model different site, clock tree model: HKY site model assumes DNA substitution rates differ transitions (purine--purine pyrimidine--pyrimidine) translations (purine--pyrimidine way around). relaxed log-normal clock model assumes mutation rates species differ, rates together follow log-normal distribution. birth-death tree model assumes new species form go extinct constant rate. mcbette shows evidence (also called marginal likelihood) inference model, likelihood model generated data. display marginal likelihoods table: important result model weights. model’s weight close one, one prefer use inference model Bayesian inference. model weights rather similar, one argue use either model. display marginal likelihoods barplot:
code: library(mcbette) fasta_filename <- beautier::get_beautier_path("anthus_aco_sub.fas") ape::image.DNAbin(ape::read.FASTA(fasta_filename)) inference_model_1 <- beautier::create_ns_inference_model() message(   paste(     inference_model_1$site_model$name,     inference_model_1$clock_model$name,     inference_model_1$tree_prior$name   ) ) #> JC69 strict yule inference_model_2 <- inference_model_1 inference_model_2$site_model <- beautier::create_hky_site_model() inference_model_2$clock_model <- beautier::create_rln_clock_model() inference_model_2$tree_prior <- beautier::create_bd_tree_prior() if (can_run_mcbette()) {   marg_liks <- est_marg_liks(     fasta_filename = fasta_filename,     inference_models = list(inference_model_1, inference_model_2)   ) } if (can_run_mcbette()) {   knitr::kable(marg_liks) } if (can_run_mcbette()) {   plot_marg_liks(marg_liks) }

what: How do I let mcbette compare all models?
title: Model Comparison Using babette
text: First, impossible, infinitely many inference models possible. Now, inference_models holds list inference models, used mcbette::est_marg_liks.
code: inference_models <- list() i <- 1 for (site_model in beautier::create_site_models()) {   for (clock_model in beautier::create_clock_models()) {     for (tree_prior in beautier::create_tree_priors()) {       inference_models[[i]] <- beautier::create_ns_inference_model(         site_model = site_model,         clock_model = clock_model,         tree_prior = tree_prior       )       i <- i + 1     }   } }

Etienne. “babette: BEAUti 2, BEAST 2 Tracer R.” Methods Ecology Evolution (2018). https://doi.org/10.1111/2041-210X.13032 Bouckaert R., Vaughan T.G., Barido-Sottani J., Duchêne S., Fourment M., Gavryushkina ., et al. (2019) BEAST 2.5: advanced software platform Bayesian evolutionary analysis. title: Abstract
text: One can generate phylogeny DNA alignment model evolution. Selecting evolutionary model non-trivial, many. mcbette R package determines model evidence generated alignment, set models. way, model ‘simple enough, simpler’ can used generate phylogeny.

title: Abstract
text: Constructing species phylogeny (right) DNA alignment (left) using evolutionary model (arrow). mcbette allows selecting evolutionary model set models. mcbette R package model comparison set evolutionary models DNA alignment, allows select model closest process consistent DNA alignment species tree. Unlike methods, mcbette can installed run R script, allowing one run many analyses using different models, examine results directly R integrate mcbette existing R pipeline.

title: Abstract
text: mcbette aimed used anyone interested phylogenetics assumes basic knowledge field. BEAST book [@Drummond:2015] serves excellent starting point field phylogenetics, mcbette README vignette show simpled worked-example. evolutionary models allowed babette R package [@Bilderbeek:2018], consist (among others) site model, clock model tree model (see ‘Supported models’ overview). babette R package work phylogenetic tool BEAST2 [@Bouckaert:2019]. Additionally, mcbette uses novel ‘NS’ ‘BEAST2’ package [@Russel:2019] actual model comparison. see demo mcbette, see vignette:

title: Abstract
text: mcbette two quirks. First, mcbette works Linux Mac, BEAST2 packages work Linux Mac (, without using GUI). Second, mcbette uses rJava package, BEAST2 written Java. Getting rJava properly installed hardest part get mcbette working.

title: Abstract
text: time writing, BEAST2 models babette supports: 1 site model: gamma site model 4 nucleotide substitution models: JC (Jukes Cantor), HKY (Hasegawa, Kishino Yano), TN (Tamura Nei), generalized time-reversible model 2 clock models: strict, relaxed log-normal 5 tree models: birth-death, coalescent Bayesian skyline, coalescent constant-population, coalescent exponential-population, Yule see :

title:
Check if the marg_liks are of the same type as returned
by est_marg_liks. — check_marg_liks

Check if the marg_liks are of the same type as returned
by est_marg_liks. — check_marg_liks
text: marg_liks table (estimated) marginal likelihoods, , example, created est_marg_liks. data.frame following columns: site_model_name: name site model,     must element get_site_model_names clock_model_name: name clock model,     must element get_clock_model_names tree_prior_name: name tree prior,     must element get_tree_prior_names marg_log_lik: estimated marginal (natural) log likelihood marg_log_lik_sd: estimated error marg_log_lik weight: relative model weight, value 1.0 (    evidence favor model combination) 0.0 (    evidence favor model combination) ess: effective sample size marginal likelihood     estimation Use get_test_marg_liks get test marg_liks. Use is_marg_liks determine marg_liks valid. Use check_marg_liks check marg_liks valid.

title:
Documentation of general function arguments.
This function does nothing.
It is intended to inherit function argument documentation. — default_params_doc
text: beast2_bin_path path BEAST2 binary file beast2_folder folder BEAST2 installed. Note folder BEAST2 executable installed: BEAST2 executable subfolder. Use get_default_beast2_folder   get default BEAST2 folder. Use get_default_beast2_bin_path   get full path default BEAST2 executable. Use get_default_beast2_jar_path   get full path default BEAST2 jar file. beast2_working_dir folder BEAST2 run produce intermediate files. default, temporary folder beast2_options beast2_options structure, can created create_mcbette_beast2_options. beast2_optionses list one beast2_options structures, can created create_mcbette_beast2_options. Use reduplicated plural achieve difference beast2_options clock_model clock model, can created create_clock_model clock_models list one clock models, can created create_clock_models epsilon measure relative accuracy. Smaller values result longer, precise estimations fasta_filename name FASTA file inference_model inference model, can created create_inference_model inference_models list one inference models, can created create_inference_model marg_liks table (estimated) marginal likelihoods, , example, created est_marg_liks. data.frame following columns: site_model_name: name site model,     must element get_site_model_names clock_model_name: name clock model,     must element get_clock_model_names tree_prior_name: name tree prior,     must element get_tree_prior_names marg_log_lik: estimated marginal (natural) log likelihood marg_log_lik_sd: estimated error marg_log_lik weight: relative model weight, value 1.0 (    evidence favor model combination) 0.0 (    evidence favor model combination) ess: effective sample size marginal likelihood     estimation Use get_test_marg_liks get test marg_liks. Use is_marg_liks determine marg_liks valid. Use check_marg_liks check marg_liks valid. mcbette_state mcbette state, list following elements: beast2_installed       TRUE BEAST2 installed,       FALSE otherwise ns_installed       NA BEAST2 installed.       TRUE BEAST2 NS package installed       FALSE BEAST2 NS package installed mcmc MCMC Nested Sampling run, can created create_mcmc_nested_sampling os name operating system, must unix (Linux, Mac) win (Windows) rng_seed random number generator seed used BEAST2 inference site_model site model, can created create_site_model site_models list one site models, can created create_site_models tree_prior tree prior, can created create_tree_prior tree_priors list one tree priors, can created create_tree_priors verbose TRUE show debug output

title: Estimate the marginal likelihood for an inference model. — est_marg_lik
text: list showing estimated marginal likelihoods (estimated error), items :: marg_log_lik: estimated marginal (natural) log likelihood marg_log_lik_sd: estimated error marg_log_lik esses Effective Sample Size

title: Estimate the marginal likelihood for an inference model. — est_marg_lik
text: Richèl J.C. Bilderbeek

title: Estimate the marginal likelihood for an inference model. — est_marg_lik
code: if (can_run_mcbette()) {    # An example FASTA file   fasta_filename <- system.file("extdata", "simple.fas", package = "mcbette")    # A testing inference model with inaccurate (thus fast) marginal   # likelihood estimation   inference_model <- beautier::create_ns_inference_model()    # Shorten the run, by doing a short (dirty, unreliable) MCMC   inference_model$mcmc <- beautier::create_test_ns_mcmc()    # Setup the options for BEAST2 to be able to call BEAST2 packages   beast2_options <- beastier::create_mcbette_beast2_options()    # Estimate the marginal likelihood   est_marg_lik(     fasta_filename = fasta_filename,     inference_model = inference_model,     beast2_options = beast2_options   )    beastier::remove_beaustier_folders() }

what: Estimate the marginal likelihoods for one or more inference models — est_marg_liks
title: Estimate the marginal likelihoods for one or more inference models — est_marg_liks
text: Estimate marginal likelihoods (aka evidence) one inference models, based single alignment. Also, marginal likelihoods compared, resulting relative weight model, relative weight model close 1.0 means model way likelier others.

title: Estimate the marginal likelihoods for one or more inference models — est_marg_liks
code: est_marg_liks(   fasta_filename,   inference_models = list(beautier::create_inference_model(mcmc =     beautier::create_ns_mcmc())),   beast2_optionses = rep(list(beastier::create_mcbette_beast2_options()), times =     length(inference_models)),   verbose = FALSE,   os = rappdirs::app_dir()$os )

title: Estimate the marginal likelihoods for one or more inference models — est_marg_liks
text: fasta_filename name FASTA file inference_models list one inference models, can created create_inference_model beast2_optionses list one beast2_options structures, can created create_mcbette_beast2_options. Use reduplicated plural achieve difference beast2_options verbose TRUE show debug output os name operating system, must unix (Linux, Mac) win (Windows)

title: Estimate the marginal likelihoods for one or more inference models — est_marg_liks
text: data.frame showing estimated marginal likelihoods (estimated error) per combination models. Columns : site_model_name: name site model clock_model_name: name clock model tree_prior_name: name tree prior marg_log_lik: estimated marginal (natural) log likelihood marg_log_lik_sd: estimated error marg_log_lik weight: relative model weight, value 1.0 (    evidence favor model combination) 0.0 (    evidence favor model combination) ess: effective sample size marginal likelihood     estimation

title: Estimate the marginal likelihoods for one or more inference models — est_marg_liks
text: process, multiple (temporary) files created ([x] denotes index list) beast2_optionses[x]$input_filename     path BEAST2 XML input file beast2_optionses[x]$output_state_filename     path BEAST2 XML state file inference_models[x]$mcmc$tracelog$filename     path BEAST2 trace file parameter estimates inference_models[x]$mcmc$treelog$filename     path BEAST2 trees file posterior trees inference_models[x]$mcmc$screenlog$filename     path BEAST2 screen output file file can deleted manually bbt_delete_temp_files, else deleted automatically operating system.

title: Estimate the marginal likelihoods for one or more inference models — est_marg_liks
text: Richèl J.C. Bilderbeek

title: Estimate the marginal likelihoods for one or more inference models — est_marg_liks
code: if (can_run_mcbette()) {    # Use an example FASTA file   fasta_filename <- system.file("extdata", "simple.fas", package = "mcbette")    # Create two inference models   inference_model_1 <- beautier::create_ns_inference_model(     site_model = beautier::create_jc69_site_model()   )   inference_model_2 <- beautier::create_ns_inference_model(     site_model = beautier::create_hky_site_model()   )    # Shorten the run, by doing a short (dirty, unreliable) MCMC   inference_model_1$mcmc <- beautier::create_test_ns_mcmc()   inference_model_2$mcmc <- beautier::create_test_ns_mcmc()    # Combine the inference models   inference_models <- list(inference_model_1, inference_model_2)    # Create the BEAST2 options, that will write the output   # to different (temporary) filanems   beast2_options_1 <- beastier::create_mcbette_beast2_options()   beast2_options_2 <- beastier::create_mcbette_beast2_options()    # Combine the two BEAST2 options sets,   # use reduplicated plural   beast2_optionses <- list(beast2_options_1, beast2_options_2)    # Compare the models   marg_liks <- est_marg_liks(     fasta_filename,     inference_models = inference_models,     beast2_optionses = beast2_optionses   )    # Interpret the results   interpret_marg_lik_estimates(marg_liks)    beastier::remove_beaustier_folders()   beastier::check_empty_beaustier_folders() }

title: Interpret the marginal likelihood estimates — interpret_marg_lik_estimates
Interpret the marginal likelihood estimates — interpret_marg_lik_estimates
text: marg_liks table (estimated) marginal likelihoods, , example, created est_marg_liks. data.frame following columns: site_model_name: name site model,     must element get_site_model_names clock_model_name: name clock model,     must element get_clock_model_names tree_prior_name: name tree prior,     must element get_tree_prior_names marg_log_lik: estimated marginal (natural) log likelihood marg_log_lik_sd: estimated error marg_log_lik weight: relative model weight, value 1.0 (    evidence favor model combination) 0.0 (    evidence favor model combination) ess: effective sample size marginal likelihood     estimation Use get_test_marg_liks get test marg_liks. Use is_marg_liks determine marg_liks valid. Use check_marg_liks check marg_liks valid.

title: Interpret the marginal likelihood estimates — interpret_marg_lik_estimates
text: Richèl J.C. Bilderbeek

what: mcbette: Model Comparison Using Babette — mcbette-package
title: mcbette: Model Comparison Using Babette — mcbette-package
text: 'mcbette' model comparing using babette, models Bayesian phylogenetic models, created create_inference_model.

title: mcbette: Model Comparison Using Babette — mcbette-package
text: main function est_marg_liks, estimate marginal likelihoods (aka evidence) one inference models, based single alignment. Also, marginal likelihoods compared, resulting relative weight model, relative weight model close 1.0 means model way likelier others. process, multiple (temporary) files created ([x] denotes index list) beast2_optionses[x]$input_filename     path BEAST2 XML input file beast2_optionses[x]$output_state_filename     path BEAST2 XML state file inference_models[x]$mcmc$tracelog$filename     path BEAST2 trace file parameter estimates inference_models[x]$mcmc$treelog$filename     path BEAST2 trees file posterior trees inference_models[x]$mcmc$screenlog$filename     path BEAST2 screen output file file can deleted manually bbt_delete_temp_files, else deleted automatically operating system.

title: mcbette: Model Comparison Using Babette — mcbette-package
text: Richèl J.C. Bilderbeek

title: mcbette: Model Comparison Using Babette — mcbette-package
code: if (can_run_mcbette()) {    # An example FASTA file   fasta_filename <- system.file("extdata", "simple.fas", package = "mcbette")    inference_model_1 <- beautier::create_ns_inference_model(     site_model = beautier::create_jc69_site_model()   )   inference_model_2 <- beautier::create_ns_inference_model(     site_model = beautier::create_gtr_site_model()   )    # Shorten the run, by doing a short (dirty, unreliable) MCMC   inference_model_1$mcmc <- beautier::create_test_ns_mcmc()   inference_model_2$mcmc <- beautier::create_test_ns_mcmc()    inference_models <- c(list(inference_model_1), list(inference_model_2))    # Estimate the marginal log-likelihoods of the two models   marg_liks <- est_marg_liks(     fasta_filename = fasta_filename,     inference_models = inference_models   )    # Interpret the results   interpret_marg_lik_estimates(marg_liks)    beastier::remove_beaustier_folders()   beastier::check_empty_beaustier_folders() }

title: Set the mcbette state. — set_mcbette_state
code: set_mcbette_state(   mcbette_state,   beast2_folder = beastier::get_default_beast2_folder(),   verbose = FALSE )

title: Set the mcbette state. — set_mcbette_state
text: mcbette_state mcbette state, list following elements: beast2_installed       TRUE BEAST2 installed,       FALSE otherwise ns_installed       NA BEAST2 installed.       TRUE BEAST2 NS package installed       FALSE BEAST2 NS package installed beast2_folder folder BEAST2 installed. Note folder BEAST2 executable installed: BEAST2 executable subfolder. Use get_default_beast2_folder   get default BEAST2 folder. Use get_default_beast2_bin_path   get full path default BEAST2 executable. Use get_default_beast2_jar_path   get full path default BEAST2 jar file. verbose TRUE show debug output

title: Set the mcbette state. — set_mcbette_state
text: newer versions BEAST2, BEAST2 comes pre-installed BEAST2 NS package. version, one install BEAST2 without NS. warning issues one intends install BEAST2 (.e. without BEAST2 NS package) gets BEAST2 NS package installed side effect well. Also, installing uninstalling BEAST2 package BEAST2 installation affect installations.
